Detailed Description

template<typename T, class TRAITS, class ALLOCATOR>
class cds::queue::TZCyclicQueue< T, TRAITS, ALLOCATOR >

Lock-free cyclic queue.

CAS-based queue based on cyclic array. The upper bound of items stored in the queue is limited.

Source:

  • [2000] Philippas Tsigas, Yi Zhang "A Simple, Fast and Scalable Non-Blocking Concurrent FIFO Queue for Shared Memory Multiprocessor Systems"

Template arguments:

  • T is type of value stored in the queue
  • TRAITS is queue's traits class; default is cds::queue::traits.
  • ALLOCATOR is memory allocator. Default is CDS_DEFAULT_ALLOCATOR
Notes
Despite its bounded nature, the queue still allocates the memory for each item. There is a specialization for pointer type: 
            template < typename T, class TRAITS, class ALLOCATOR >
            class TZCyclicQueue< T *, TRAITS, ALLOCATOR > ;
TZCyclicQueue<T *, TRAITS, ALLOCATOR> The specialization is free from memory allocation for each item.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

template<typename T , class TRAITS , class ALLOCATOR >
cds::queue::TZCyclicQueue< T, TRAITS, ALLOCATOR >::TZCyclicQueue ( unsigned int  nPow2 = 20 ) [inline]

Constructs queue.

The capacity of cyclic array is 2**nPow2, nPow2 <= 31

Note, the real capacity of queue is 2**nPow2 - 2.

Member Function Documentation

template<typename T , class TRAITS , class ALLOCATOR >
size_t cds::queue::TZCyclicQueue< T, TRAITS, ALLOCATOR >::capacity (  ) const [inline]

Return capacity of the queue.

The queue's capacity is not real size of array allocated for the items. For TZCyclicQueue it is N - 2, where N - max queue size passed in construction time

template<typename T , class TRAITS , class ALLOCATOR >
bool cds::queue::TZCyclicQueue< T, TRAITS, ALLOCATOR >::dequeue ( T &  data ) [inline]

Dequeues a value to dest. If queue is empty returns false, dest is not changed. If queue is not empty returns true, dest contains the value dequeued

template<typename T , class TRAITS , class ALLOCATOR >
bool cds::queue::TZCyclicQueue< T, TRAITS, ALLOCATOR >::enqueue ( const T &  newData ) [inline]

Enqueues data in lock-free manner.

Since the queue is based on an array and has upper limit of items contained, the method may return false if queue is full
